modules:
package test

p := $""

package test

p := $"foo bar baz"

package test

p := $"\t\n\""

package test

p := $"{42}, {13.37}, {true}, {"foo"}, {null}"

package test

# no multi-value sets and maps, as order can't be guaranteed
p := $"{[]}, {[42, 13.37, true, "foo", null]}, {set()}, {{42}}, {{}}, {{"a": "b"}}"

package test

a := ["a", "b", "c"]

p := $"{[x | some x in a]}"

package test

a := ["a"]

# no multi-value sets, as order can't be guaranteed
p := $"{{x | some x in a}}"

package test

# no multi-value maps, as order can't be guaranteed
a := ["a"]

p := $"{{x: x | some x in a}}"

package test

a := "foo"
b := "bar"

p := $"{a} {b}"

package test

a := "foo"

p := $"{data.test.a} {data.b} {input.c}"

package test

a := "foo"
b := "bar"

p := $"{$"{a}"} {$"{$"{b}"} baz"}"

cases.note: string-interpolation/nested template expressions, undefined outer expression
modules:
package test

p := $"{$"{data.a}"} {$"{$"{data.b}"} baz"}"

cases.note: string-interpolation/nested template expressions, undefined inner expression
modules:
package test

p := $"{$"{data.a}"} {$"{$"{data.b}"} baz"}"

cases.note: string-interpolation/template expressions with infix operand call
modules:
package test

a := 42

p := $"sum: {1 + a}"

package test

p := $"{input.x}, {data.y}"

package test

a := ["foo", "bar"]

p := [x | some y in a; x := $"<{y}>"]

package test

a := "foo"

# Only generate one entry to avoid non-deterministic ordering.
p := {x | x = $"<{a}>"}

package test

a := input.a
b := input.b

p := x if {
  x := $"foo {a} {b}"
    with input.a as 42
    with input.b as "bar"
}
